Commercial Project 11 - Belstaff, Regent Street

Belstaffs flagship store is located on the desirable Regent Street in London. Designer stores galore, Regent Street is renowned worldwide for its opulent buildings and big household names. Offering an eclectic mix of independent retailers and long-established brands, it was this and the nearby buzz of Soho that made Regent Street the ideal location for their flagship store.

The Main Company has worked on a number of Belstaff stores, but it was especially exciting to be involved in their flagship store. As well as housing their much-loved clothing, Belstaff Regent Street is also a social space, with barista coffee and perfectly mixed G&T on hand, plus curated events, from screenings to podcast recordings.

Many of the Belstaff values are similar to ours, we pride ourselves on quality and great craftsmanship. The brand is steeped in British heritage, something that we wanted to capture in the materials used. The idea of the store was to showcase their community first approach, with their goal being to create an immersive experience for customers. Not only do they want to inspire customers, they also want the space to excite and inspire staff, creating an environment that people love to work.

We have provided bespoke products to many retail spaces and we know the importance of complementing the space, rather than providing something that will divert attention. Our Reclaimed Engineered Oak flooring was the perfect choice, not only does it look great, but it has been hand-finished, creating a durable surface, ideal for a store with a heavy foot fall, especially in such a prominent location. The layout and décor is similar to that of the Spitalfields store that we supplied flooring for, the Reclaimed Engineered Oak has a classy and rustic appearance, and allows the industrial style interior and clothing to shine. The subtle tones of the Oak are complemented by the addition of Aztec and Jute rugs and railings.

Each and every plank has been salvaged from handpicked, interesting buildings. Our team then works incredibly hard to restore the planks, enhancing the natural features of the wood, intensifying the patina and preserving any interesting markings. Once finished, the planks are treated with an oil, creating a durable surface. We supplied the planks in a variety of widths and lengths adding to the personality of the space.

Project11
ProductReclaimed Engineered Oak Floor
ClientBelstaff, Regent Street

Commercial Project 10 - St Michaels Spa, Falmouth

Located on the picturesque Cornish coast, St Michaels Hotel & Spa is passionate about creating an environment from which guests can experience the best in Cornish hospitality. Their ‘feel good again’ philosophy is embraced in all aspects of the hotel, from locally sourced ingredients to their beautiful, sustainable interiors that complement the coastal location.

The ideal destination to relax and unwind, even within the hotel, you feel close to the sea thanks to the nautical and rustic interiors. From the moment you step inside, you’re surrounded by quality, bespoke Main Company products. Our Reclaimed Silver Wood Cladding has been used in a variety of ways. From the health club reception to stunning feature walls. From staircases to headboards, it was wonderful to be involved in this project, working alongside many talents.

Earthy tones, whites and blues are the main themes throughout, tying in perfectly to the surroundings. Our Reclaimed and rustic materials work alongside this theme beautifully, thanks to the weathered and characterful feel of the planks.

For the entrance for the health club, our cladding made the perfect choice for the reception desk and surrounding area. Our hand finished wood, has been meticulously worked, creating a bespoke solution for the space. Within the spa, we created a stunning feature wall using our Reclaimed Silver Wood Cladding, complementing the surrounding environment and creating the perfect sanctuary to relax in. A feature wall with a twist, windows and shelves have been built in, with candles finishing the space beautifully. A lovely seating area has also been created, where spa guests can sit back and reflect on their time spent at St Michaels Spa.

Not only did the Main Company supply high quality wood for the health club and spa, we also supplied cladding for the main stairwell within the space and for the new guest rooms. The rooms at St Michael’s Spa, offer the best in contemporary Cornish design, the Beach House themed rooms offer light and airy accommodation, perfect for unwinding at the end of the day. Our Reclaimed Silver Wood Cladding was used within the rooms for bespoke headboards, these unique headboards, continue slightly on to the ceiling, giving a unique yet decadent look.

As well as our beautiful residential projects, The Main Company is also supplier of choice for many commercial projects across the United Kingdom. We are especially proud of the project at St Michaels Spa as it showcases the diverse range of bespoke interiors that we can help with.

Project10
ProductReclaimed Silver Wood Cladding
ClientSt Michaels Spa, Falmouth

Commercial Project 8 - Beech House, Amersham

Set in a stunning location in the Chiltern district in Buckinghamshire, Beech House is a beautiful space where like-minded people can come together and enjoy great food and drinks, whilst catching up with friends, family and colleagues. Located on Hill Avenue in the heart of Amersham, it was important that that the timber elements captured the essence and character of the surrounding historical town.

The Main Company’s reclaimed timbers were specified by Harrison who create successful hospitality concepts across the world. Armfield Retail were the main contractor who brought the concept to life using the beautiful reclaimed timbers to create a stunning project.

The moment you set foot inside Beech House, you are submerged into an inviting yet luxurious setting. One where it feels like a treat and makes the hustle and bustle of everyday life worth it, and where you forget about the outside world.

Rustic with a touch of luxe, our Reclaimed Barn Oak has been used in abundance, contrasted by brick work and rich, opulent jewel shades such as burgundy and emerald, creating a cosy setting.  Our Reclaimed Engineered Barn Oak was the perfect choice for this project and provided a rustic and cosy setting, ideal for what Beech House wanted to achieve. The Weathered Barn Oak offered the space a beautiful rustic feel that was instantly available, using the 7-120-year-old barn timbers that have been carefully reclaimed from old agricultural barns throughout Europe.

The stunning bar area is the perfect space for relaxing with a drink in hand, whilst admiring the deep and sultry ambience of your surroundings. The parquet flooring adds a decadent touch, giving the impression of more space and the quality Oak has been meticulously crafted, ensuring a durable finish that is essential for the footfall of a busy space like Beech House. The cladding uses the same Reclaimed Oak and has been beautifully contrasted by subway style tiles, completing the look. Further to this, we wanted to create some unique talking points and continued the wall cladding over the ceiling area, resulting in a fantastic floating ceiling that has been further complemented by characterful features such as the window we created, allowing light to flow freely from one area to another.

The Main Company works tirelessly to ensure that we use the highest of quality materials, and each and every piece has been hand-crafted and finished to the highest of standards. This all takes place at our workshop in the heart of Yorkshire, between York and Harrogate. This allows us to work with you to create wonderfully bespoke projects, with everything made to specification.

Project8
ProductReclaimed Engineered Barn Oak
ClientBeech House, Amersham

Commercial Project 7 - Eagle Mill, Huntingdon

Set in wondrous countryside, Eagle Mill is an 18th century millworker’s cottage with a purpose built, architect designed bed and breakfast extension attached. The location couldn’t be better, with the market towns of Huntingdon and St Ives just miles away or Cambridge or London can be reached in less than an hour. The area is also surrounded by countryside and river walks of the Ouse valley.

Although new, the extension has been sympathetically built, capturing the beauty and character of the original building. For the Eagle Mill project, we were pleased to supply the flooring throughout, complementing the luxurious country house feel, whilst adding a rustic touch.

Within the breakfast room our Engineered Distillery Oak was used for the flooring. A timeless and elegant choice, the Oak comprises a darker, cool tone, complemented by a rustic grain. The ideal choice for anybody wanting to achieve a characterful and rustic ambience. A selection of hand finishing techniques have been used to create this highly desirable Oak. The Distillery Oak complements the Duck Egg blue cabinetry perfectly, offsetting the cooler colour with its rich hue. The room was complete with our impressive bistro tables, the original mill board is cold pressed onto birch plywood making them a durable and stable table that will stand the test of time. The rustic aesthetic of the mill board completed beautiful breakfast room.

Each and every plank goes through our on-site kiln, ridding it of excess moisture and creating a hardwearing wood, perfect for a bed and breakfast environment. Our Distillery Oak can also be found in one of the bedrooms, paired perfectly with exposed wooden beams and panel detail, creating the perfect blend of opulence and country chic, finished beautifully with a free-standing bathtub and velvet chairs.

Our Reclaimed Oak was also used in another of the bedrooms, a slightly cooler and more weathered wood, this was the perfect choice to sit alongside the browns and blacks used throughout the interiors. Not only do the rooms look outstanding, each room is crammed with luxuries, ensuring your stay will be memorable.

All our wood is supplied to specification, to a width and length to match your requirements. Our stunning flooring is also compatible with under floor heating, making it the ideal choice all year round. All our wood has been carefully sourced and meticulously handcrafted to the highest of standards.

Project7
ProductsEngineered Distillery Oak & Reclaimed Oak
ClientEagle Mill, Huntingdon

Commercial Project 6 - Tonkotsu, Shoreditch

With restaurants across Birmingham and London, Tonkotsu put their heart and soul into making sure each and every bowl of ramen that leaves their kitchen, will rock your world. They believe that there is no experience more fulfilling than serving their modern ramen, in their unique and stunning restaurants.

We, at The Main Company, were delighted to be chosen to supply materials for use within the new Shoreditch location. Our Reclaimed Linen Grey Mill Board was the perfect choice to sit alongside the quirky interior of the modern Japanese restaurant. We are renowned for our expertise and high-quality materials, which is why we are supplier of choice for many interior designers. We work alongside designers, to help bring their visions to reality.

Our Reclaimed Linen Grey Mill Board was the perfect choice for the cladding within the Shoreditch restaurant, this was used on the walls and also to create bespoke seating booths. A different wood was used as an overlay, creating a unique panel effect that tied in the unique design of the restaurant. The perfect combination of old meets new, the red interiors paired with the rustic wood, capture traditional Japanese style perfectly, whilst giving it a modern twist.

Our Reclaimed Linen Grey Mill Board is a highly sought-after shade. Originating from Northern Roof Spars, the wood has been beautifully weathered, creating a sandy, grey shade with a stunning patina. Each and every plank has been beautifully hand-finished at our workshop, between the spa town of Harrogate and historic city of York. Each piece is dried to the perfect moisture content in our on-site kiln and supplied to specification.

It is always wonderful to see how our wood is used, whether that’s as flooring, cladding and other creative projects.

Project6
Product(s)
ClientTonkotsu, Shoreditch

Commercial Project 5 - Belstaff, Lamb Street

Steeped in British Heritage, Belstaff is an international brand with stores in iconic and affluent locations such as Regent Street and New York. Spitalfields is a lively East End area, home to artists and creatives and the area is well known for street art and quirky stores.

Belstaff wanted their new retail space to showcase their community first approach, with their goal being to create an immersive and interactive experience. As well as feeling relaxed and at home, they wanted to inspire their staff and customers with a space full of character, personality and the craftsmanship you would expect from the brand.

In a retail space, it’s important to complement the clothing rather than overpower it, and our Designer and Project Manager worked tirelessly with Belstaff to create a setting that complemented their clothing and reinforced their timeless and classic brand and values.

Obviously, retail spaces attract a large foot fall so it was important to use a material that could withstand the traffic entering and exiting the shop, especially in such a prominent area of London.  Our Reclaimed Engineered Weathered Barn Flooring encompassed everything Belstaff wanted to achieve. The earthy brown and silvery tones provided the perfect base to show case and complement the high end Belstaff products. The subtle tones are further enhanced by the interiors of the store, exposed brick work, Aztec and jute rugs combined with deep leathers, perfectly enhance the patina and colours of the wood and are further accompanied by industrial style railings, finishing off the look.

Our Weathered Barn Oak adds an abundance of character to any space, each and every plank has been salvaged from old European agricultural barns and has been painstakingly restored, offering a truly unique and bespoke product. The planks were supplied and fitted in a variety of widths and lengths adding to the personality of the space. We are incredibly proud of this project and are confident our wooden flooring creates the perfect base for the store.

Project5
ProductReclaimed Weathered Barn Oak
ClientBelstaff, Lamb Street

Commercial Project 1 - Cripps, Bolton Abbey

Situated in Skipton, in the heart of the Yorkshire Dales, The Tithe Barn is a sought-after wedding location, with views over the historic ruins of Bolton Abbey Priory. Set amongst woodland, footpaths and rivers, the landscape surrounding Bolton Abbey estate is often described as a ‘jewel-in-the-crown’ within the Yorkshire landscape. The beautiful barn is licensed for civil marriage ceremonies, with space for up to 200 seated guests. Alternatively, wedding celebrations can be hosted, following a ceremony in one of the local churches.

With high ceilings and characterful features, the barn offers a wonderful space that would complement a variety of wedding themes and look lovely in photographs for years to come. The barn comprises of the perfect mix of wood, brick and greenery and has been finished off with a dusting of sparkling lights, creating the perfect ambience for a celebration. Come night-time, the barn transforms to party central, the barn has a late-night license to operate until 1am and there’s a state-of-the-art Funktion-One system, perfect for getting guests dancing.

We are known for our high-quality materials and bespoke products and we were happy to be involved in this project. The Main Company supplied Reclaimed Barn Oak Cladding to be used around the barn, tying in beautifully to the original, rustic surroundings. The barn cladding was used to create impressive feature walls and brought a rustic element to the open plan kitchen. Guest can see into the open kitchen with indoor BBQ and rotisseries the newly built kitchens required the 100 year old barn cladding allowing the original structure of the Tithe barn and kitchen to run together harmoniously.

Our Reclaimed Barn Oak Cladding has been sourced from European agricultural barns, making it the perfect choice for complementing the surroundings of The Tithe Barn. Our cladding is then dried to ideal moisture content at our on-site kiln, creating a stable and durable surface. The wood is then meticulously handcrafted at our workshop, located between York and Harrogate, using a variety of techniques.

Whether it’s a residential or commercial space, our wood cladding can be used in a number of ways, from walls to ceilings and even headboards, there’s so many uses and it really does create the perfect focal point. The Main Company also supplied Reclaimed Oak Beams and wood for projects within the building, so please do get in touch if we can help you make your visions a reality.

Project1
ProductReclaimed Barn Oak
ClientCripps, Bolton Abbey

Framed Glass Counter Screen

Like many businesses, we have had to adjust in accordance with government guidelines around COVID-19. To help protect both staff and customers, we have created these high-quality framed glass screens.

A beautiful alternative to fixed Perspex screens, we are able to manufacture counter screens to any desired specification, measurements, design and colour, so they can be in keeping with your brand and aesthetic, whilst keeping everybody safe. The screens sit on two feet, avoiding have to drill any holes or fit the screens, they can just stand on your existing counters.

Priced upon request.

Commercial Project 13 - Kindred, Hammersmith

Set in the heart of London, in Hammersmith, Kindred is surrounded by stunning architecture and the buzz of city life. Kindred is a member’s club with a heart for community and connection, something that they wanted to emphasise within their welcoming and relaxing interiors.

The Main Company was specified by Luca from ShawStudio. Luca had been searching long and hard to find a company that had the expertise and flexibility to create an oak that was rustic but also had a warm undertone. The Reclaimed heritage Oak was the perfect base product for us to create this bespoke floor for Kindred. The Main Company could provide an engineered solution that could be fitted directly onto the concrete sub base, saving time and money for the main contractor, BB Contracts.

The space incorporates a café, bar, restaurant, live event space, meeting rooms and co-working space, with their main focus to bring people together. The idea for Kindred was born out of a desire to find a solution to the growing isolation and disconnection in London, something we think they do perfectly.

The area is light and airy, thanks to the high ceilings and large windows that create a sun-soaked space. Original features are enhanced and contrasted by modern additions such as light features and a fire acts as a focal point. Sumptuous velvets and gold detailing complete the look and add that touch of luxury you would expect from a member’s club.

The brief set by Shaw Studios London was to create a reclaimed engineered board that had burnt tones running throughout the planks, making the boards look like they had been part of the beautiful original structure which is brimming with characterful features such as intricate coving.

Our Reclaimed Engineered Old Oak was the perfect solution. The Reclaimed Oak was supplied in random widths, adding to the charm and character of the surroundings. The hand rolled edges and original pegs randomly intersecting the boards are a nod to their previous life within agricultural buildings across Europe. The oak creates a warm and cosy setting and is full of character, the knots and deep patina really pop amongst the cooler interiors. The Oak has been hand finished by our master craftsmen, at our family run workshop in Yorkshire, creating a hardy and durable floor, that will stand the test of time.

At The Main Company, we pride ourselves on collaborating with brands to help make their visions a reality, using the highest quality of materials.

Project13
ProductReclaimed Engineered Heritage Oak
ClientKindred, Hammersmith

Commercial Project 9 - Archer Street, Battersea

The feel of a member’s bar, without the membership. This was the brief that Archer Street supplied for us. Archer Street, Battersea is the newest addition to South West London. The experiential bar is perfect for Londoners looking for a fun night of expertly crafted cocktails and dancing on the tables. The bar spans over two floors, the first is a cocktail bar and then on the lower ground floor, there is themed bar.

When it came to the design and ambience of the themed bar, inspiration was taken in bucket loads from Après-Ski type environments. Think rustic, textured woods paired with faux furs, sheepskins and leathers. We wanted to bring the aesthetics and exclusive feel of the slopes to central London.

No task is too large for our team and our Designer and Project Manager worked with the client to envisage and create the perfect alpine-style environment. The timber-clad chalet style bar offers a cosy and welcoming retreat, the perfect space to sip a glass of wine or treat yourself to an Aperol Spritz after a busy day at work.

Silver Barn Board Cladding was the perfect addition to this space, the combination of the sun and rain has created a wonderful weathered structure which has striking silver and grey colouration, perfect for the ambience of the space. The wood has been sourced from agricultural buildings throughout Europe, and each board is oozing with charm and character. The planks are also textured with a natural finish, further adding to the rustic feel of the surroundings. The Silver Barn Board has been perfectly paired with focal areas featuring our Engineered Distressed Oak cladding which has been hand-crafted to create the desired look.

The look is finished with our Distressed Smoked Brown Engineered Flooring, adding warmth to the space and providing a durable surface for Archer Street.

Renowned for crafting highly individual bespoke kitchens and interiors, we love working with our clients and bringing their creative visions to life, we think Archer Street looks fantastic and offers a sense of escapism, it’s easy to forget you’re in London!

Project9
ProductsEngineered Distressed Oak & Silver Wooden Wall Cladding
ClientArcher Street, Battersea

Reclaimed Oak Coffee Table

Here at The Main Company, we are passionate about reclaimed and natural materials. Whether we are creating furniture or bespoke kitchens, we take pride in everything that we do.

This outstanding coffee table has been handcrafted using 150-year-old oak and has a textured, natural appearance, complete with original holes and cracks. Thanks to the natural appearance of the table and the soft edges, it’s versatile and would work beautifully in almost any space.

The table stands on 4 chunky legs, also made from 150-year-old and features a handy shelf, ideal for books or board games.

Large Antique Mirror

This one of a kind Large Antique Mirror would create an outstanding focal point in any space. Made from reclaimed wood, this truly is a unique piece. The ribbed planks were originally painted but have been sanded down leaving areas of the original paint behind, to create an interesting and distressed look.

The detail on this mirror is second to none, from the combination of the white, green and exposed wood grain to the smoked glass mirror. This piece is ideal for transforming any space, it can be hung or used as a leaner mirror, the choice is yours.

The mirror has been handcrafted at our workshop between Harrogate and York, made from high quality, reclaimed materials to ensure this mirror will stand the test of time. Thanks to its distressed and antique appearance, this mirror will get better as time goes on.
